properties.areaDesc: Clear Lake/Southern Lake County; Southern Sacramento Valley; Motherlode; Northern Sacramento Valley; Shasta Lake Area / Northern Shasta County; West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Western Plumas County/Lassen Park; Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Northern Lake County; Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County; Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 3 at 5:11AM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
A cold air mass will linger over the area over the next few days.
Temperatures in the Valley may drop to around freezing in wind
sheltered areas, potentially into the upper 20s locally in some
spots in the northern San Joaquin Valley and the foothills, with
single digits to 20s in the mountains. Some breezy northerly
winds continue, becoming gusty in the afternoon for Monday and
Tuesday.

* Timing: This morning through Wednesday morning.

* Low Temperatures: Monday morning lows in the single digits and
teens in the mountains, low to mid 30s in the Valley and
foothills. Tuesday morning lows in the single digits to 20s in
the mountains, low 30s in the Sacramento Valley, low 30s down to
locally upper 20s in the northern San Joaquin Valley and
foothills.

* High temperatures: Monday and Tuesday in the 30s and 40s in the
mountains, low to mid 50s in the Valley. Wednesday 40s to 50 in
the mountains, mid 50s to mid 60s in the Valley.

* Winds: Afternoon wind gusts 20 to 30 mph in the Valley and 30 to
40 mph over higher mountains Monday and Tuesday.

* Impacts: Cold temperatures could injure sensitive outdoor
plants. Winds combined with cold temperatures in the mountains
could affect outdoor recreation activities.

NWSheadline: Cold Morning Temperatures Through Wednesday Morning... ...Breezy North Winds into Tuesday
